author: timesunion.com
title: Seahawks' slide stopped
text:
Photo: Marcio Jose Sanchez Image 1 of / 2 2 Seattle Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson (3) passes against the San Francisco 49ers during the first half of an NFL football game in Santa Clara, Calif., Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. (AP Photo/Marcio Jose Sanchez) ORG XMIT: FXN108 Seattle Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson (3) passes against the San Francisco 49ers during the first half of an NFL football game in Santa Clara, Calif., Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. (AP Photo/Marcio Jose ... more Image 2 of 2 SAN DIEGO, CA - AUGUST 29: Running back Marshawn Lynch #24 of the Seattle Seahawks on the sidelines during the game with the San Diego Chargers during preseason at Qualcomm Stadium on August 29, 2015 in San Diego, California. The Seahawks won 16-15. (Photo by Stephen Dunn/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 565471773 SAN DIEGO, CA - AUGUST 29: Running back Marshawn Lynch #24 of the Seattle Seahawks on the sidelines during the game with the San Diego Chargers during preseason at Qualcomm Stadium on August 29, 2015 in San ... more Seahawks' slide stopped 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Santa Clara, Calif.
Russell Wilson threw a 43-yard touchdown pass to Tyler Lockett late in the first half, Marshawn Lynch jumped the pile for a one-yard score, and the Seattle Seahawks beat the San Francisco 49ers 20-3 on Thursday for their fourth straight win in this rivalry.
The Seahawks whipped San Francisco (2-5) in Levi's Stadium on a Thursday in prime time 11 months after Richard Sherman chomped turkey on the field here last Thanksgiving night following a 19-3 victory.
Wilson completed 10 of his first 12 passes and finished with 235 yards passing. He was sacked five times to push his NFL-leading total to 31.
Lynch ran for 122 yards despite vomiting on the sideline in the first half as Seattle (3-4) won its first road game in four tries, avoiding another fourth-quarter collapse.
In a game lacking its usual intrigue with both teams trying to save their seasons and with Pete Carroll missing coaching nemesis Jim Harbaugh , Wilson made the key plays and Colin Kaepernick struggled once again facing Seattle.
Lloyd retires: Wide receiver Brandon Lloyd has announced his retirement after 11 NFL seasons. In a statement issued Thursday, Lloyd said he has no regrets and is "blessed to leave the game in such a healthy and happy place." The 34-year-old receiver played for six teams in his 142-game career. He led the league in yards receiving (1,448) in 2010, the only year he was selected for the Pro Bowl. Lloyd finished with 399 career receptions for 5,989 yards and 36 touchdowns.
Bears: Chicago cut Jeremiah Ratliff on Thursday a day after the defensive lineman was seen having an animated discussion with general manager Ryan Pace . The exchange between Ratliff and Pace occurred in a parking lot outside of the team's suburban facility.
Chargers: Mayor Kevin Faulconer said San Diego's push to build a new stadium for the Chargers took "a huge step forward" when Gov. Jerry Brown approved an accelerated judicial review process for any lawsuits filed against the project's environmental impact report. Once enacted by the legislature's joint budget committee, the certification means any lawsuit challenging the EIR must be resolved within 270 days of the city's certifying the document.
